title: Carlos Huntley-Robertson
text:
Charles Alfred Huntley-Robertson (born Carlos Alfredo Huntley Robertson; 23 March 1908 – 1982) was a British-<a href="Argentine">Argentine</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He was the Captain of <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Los Pumas</a> in 1932.
Career.
Huntley-Robertson was born in <a href="Lima">Lima</a>, <a href="Peru">Peru</a>, to a South American mother, Alida Pendavis, and Capt. James Huntley-Robertson, who was born in <a href="Miraflores%2C%20Mexico">Miraflores, Mexico</a> to a Scottish father, John Moir Robertson, and Peruvian mother, Paz Besseser de Robertson. James Huntley-Robertson served with the 2nd Mounted Infantry Contingent from Western Australia and the <a href="Bushveldt%20Carbineers">Bushveldt Carbineers</a> in the <a href="Second%20Boer%20War">Second Boer War</a>, and then worked on the railways in Chile, Peru and Argentina prior to the First World War, when he was awarded the <a href="Military%20Cross">Military Cross</a> for his service in the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Somme">Battle of the Somme</a>.
Though he was born Carlos Alfredo, he used the name Charles Alfred. He started his rugby playing career at <a href="Buenos%20Aires%20Cricket%20%26amp%3B%20Rugby%20Club">Buenos Aires Cricket & Rugby Club</a>.
On July 16, 1932, Huntley-Robertson made its debut in the <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina national team</a>, playing his first <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">Test match</a> against <a href="South%20Africa%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa</a>, with a score 42-0 in favor of the <a href="South%20Africa%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Springboks</a>. On July 23, had played their second game against the Springboks with a victory of <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>n team by 34-3. Both matches were played at the stadium of the <a href="Club%20Ferro%20Carril%20Oeste">Club Ferro Carril Oeste</a>.
In 1936, Huntley-Robertson was the <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">Coach</a> of the national team together <a href="Luis%20Cilley">Luis Cilley</a> and <a href="Edmundo%20Stanfield">Edmundo Stanfield</a>.
In 1940, Huntley-Robertson married Barbara Hiroth Verity in <a href="London">London</a>.
